hero_subtitle: Build native UIs for iOS, Android, and Web with a single JSON definition
code_example_subtitle: Define your UI once in JSON, deploy everywhere
feature_write_once_desc: Single JSON definition works across all platforms
footer_copyright: Copyright © 2025 TANOSYS, LLC. Built with ReactJsonUI.
learn_subtitle: Master cross-platform UI development with JSON
learn_getting_started_desc: Set up your first JsonUI project in minutes
learn_installation_desc: Install JsonUI for your target platform
learn_quick_start_desc: Build your first UI component with JSON
learn_json_basics_desc: Learn the fundamentals of JsonUI syntax
learn_styling_desc: Apply styles and create reusable themes
learn_data_binding_desc: Connect your UI to data sources
learn_advanced_desc: Master Include system and custom components
learn_tutorial_subtitle: Learn the basics of JsonUI in 3 simple steps
learn_step1_desc: Every UI starts with a View container. Views can hold other components and define layout direction.
learn_step2_desc: Add buttons and handle user interactions with onClick handlers.
learn_step3_desc: Use @{} syntax to bind dynamic data to your UI components.
learn_advanced_subtitle: Master Include system, styles, localization, and more
learn_include_desc: Reuse layouts across your app with the Include component. Break large layouts into smaller, maintainable pieces.
learn_styles_desc: Define reusable styles in separate JSON files and apply them with the style attribute.
learn_localization_desc: Use string keys instead of hardcoded text to support multiple languages.
learn_collections_subtitle: Build dynamic lists and interactive forms
learn_collection_desc: Render dynamic lists by binding data arrays. Each item is rendered using the child template.
learn_form_desc: Build forms with TextField, Button, and other input components.
ref_subtitle: Complete documentation for JsonUI components and attributes
ref_components_desc: View, Label, Button, Image, TextField, and more
ref_attributes_desc: Size, color, font, padding, margin, and layout properties
ref_include_desc: Reuse JSON layouts with the Include component
ref_styles_desc: Define and apply reusable style templates
platforms_subtitle: JsonUI runs everywhere you need it
platforms_swift_features: UIKit & SwiftUI support, Hot reload, CocoaPods & SPM
platforms_kotlin_features: Compose & XML support, Hot reload, Maven & Gradle
platforms_react_features: React & Tailwind support, Hot reload, npm & yarn
preview_view_desc: Horizontal View with padding and background
installation_subtitle: Get started with JsonUI on your platform
quick_start_subtitle: Build your first JsonUI component in minutes
qs_swift_step1_desc: Use the CLI to create a new view with ViewModel and layout file.
qs_swift_step2_desc: Edit the generated JSON file to define your UI structure.
qs_swift_step3_desc: Generate Swift code and start hot reload for instant updates.
qs_kotlin_step1_desc: Use the CLI to create a new view with ViewModel and layout file.
qs_kotlin_step2_desc: Edit the generated JSON file to define your UI structure.
qs_kotlin_step3_desc: Generate Kotlin code and start hot reload for instant updates.
qs_react_step1_desc: Use the CLI to create a new view with ViewModel and layout file.
qs_react_step2_desc: Edit the generated JSON file to define your UI structure.
qs_react_step3_desc: Generate React components and start watch mode for instant updates.
styling_subtitle: Apply styles and create reusable themes
styling_inline_desc: Apply styles directly on components using attributes like background, padding, and fontSize.
styling_template_desc: Define reusable styles in separate JSON files and apply them with the style attribute.
data_binding_subtitle: Connect your UI to data sources dynamically
data_binding_basics_desc: Use @{} syntax to bind properties to your UI components.
data_binding_collections_desc: Bind arrays to Collection components to render dynamic lists.
comp_detail_uikit_support: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUIView
comp_detail_compose_support: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to Box/Column/Row
comp_detail_android_xml_support: • Android XML: Maps to LinearLayout or ConstraintLayout
comp_detail_react_support: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to div with Tailwind CSS
comp_view_desc: The fundamental container component for building layouts. View acts as a flexible container that can hold other components and supports various layout configurations.
comp_label_desc: A text display component for showing static or dynamic text content. Supports rich text formatting, links, and partial text styling.
comp_label_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUILabel
comp_label_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to Text
comp_label_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to span with Tailwind CSS
comp_button_desc: An interactive button component that responds to user taps. Supports various styles and click handlers.
comp_button_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUIButton
comp_button_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to Button
comp_button_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to button with Tailwind CSS
comp_textfield_desc: A single-line text input component for user input. Supports placeholder text, keyboard types, and validation.
comp_textfield_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUITextField
comp_textfield_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to TextField
comp_textfield_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to input with Tailwind CSS
comp_textview_desc: A multi-line text input component for longer user input. Supports scrolling and dynamic height.
comp_textview_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUITextView
comp_textview_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to TextField with multiline
comp_textview_android_xml: • Android XML: Maps to KjuiEditText with multiline
comp_textview_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to textarea with Tailwind CSS
comp_switch_desc: A toggle switch component for boolean on/off states. Supports custom colors and change handlers.
comp_switch_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUISwitch
comp_switch_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to Switch
comp_slider_desc: A slider component for selecting values within a range. Supports min/max values and step increments.
comp_slider_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUISlider
comp_slider_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to Slider
comp_slider_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to input[type=range] with Tailwind CSS
comp_scrollview_desc: A scrollable container component for content that exceeds the viewport. Supports vertical and horizontal scrolling.
comp_scrollview_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUIScrollView
comp_scrollview_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to LazyColumn/LazyRow
comp_scrollview_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to div with overflow-auto
comp_collection_desc: A dynamic list component for rendering data arrays. Supports item templates, headers, and data binding.
comp_collection_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUICollectionView
comp_collection_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to LazyColumn
comp_collection_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to mapped array with Tailwind CSS
ref_components_overview_desc: JsonUI provides a rich set of components for building cross-platform user interfaces.
ref_view_overview: View is the fundamental container component for building layouts in JsonUI.
ref_attr_layout_desc: Layout attributes control how components are sized and positioned within their parent containers.
ref_attr_styling_desc: Styling attributes control the visual appearance of components.
ref_attr_typography_desc: Typography attributes control text rendering and formatting.
ref_data_binding_overview: Data binding in JsonUI provides powerful reactive UI capabilities, allowing views to automatically update when data changes. Use the @{} syntax to bind view properties to data variables.
ref_binding_basic_desc: Use @{propertyName} to bind a component property to a ViewModel value. The UI automatically updates when the bound value changes.
ref_binding_data_declaration_desc: Define data models using the data array. Each entry specifies a variable with name, class (type), and optional defaultValue.
ref_binding_data_class: class - Swift/Kotlin type: String, Bool, Int, Float, custom classes (required)
ref_binding_data_default: defaultValue - Initial value as code string (optional)
ref_binding_expressions_desc: JsonUI supports Swift-like expressions within @{}. You can use optional chaining, ternary operators, method calls, and string interpolation.
ref_binding_optional_desc: Safely access optional properties using ?. syntax to prevent null crashes.
ref_binding_ternary_desc: Use conditional expressions for dynamic values: @{condition ? valueIfTrue : valueIfFalse}
ref_binding_visibility_desc: Control component visibility based on data state using visible, invisible, or gone values.
ref_binding_styling_desc: Apply dynamic styles based on data conditions for colors, fonts, and other visual properties.
ref_binding_nested_desc: Access nested object properties with dot notation: @{user.profile.name}
ref_binding_collections_desc: Bind arrays to Collection components using the items attribute. Use cellClasses to define cell views, or sections for SwiftUI/Compose.
ref_binding_twoway_desc: For input fields, use @{} binding with event handlers like onTextChange to sync data. The binding displays data while the handler updates it.
ref_binding_null_safety_desc: Handle optional values safely with nil-coalescing: @{user?.name ?? 'Anonymous'}
ref_binding_groups_desc: Group related bindings with binding_group for coordinated batch updates and improved performance.
ref_binding_include_desc: Pass data to included components using data attribute. The included component receives values via its data declaration.
ref_binding_practice_1: Use optional chaining (?.) for null safety
ref_binding_practice_2: Keep expressions simple - move complex logic to ViewModel
ref_binding_practice_3: Use binding groups for related UI elements
ref_binding_practice_4: Provide default values for better initialization
ref_include_overview: The Include system allows you to reuse JSON layouts across your application. Break large layouts into smaller, maintainable pieces and share data between parent and child components.
ref_include_attr_include_desc: Path to the JSON file to include (e.g., 'header.json' or 'components/header.json')
ref_include_attr_data_desc: Object containing data to pass to the included component. Overrides shared_data values if both are present
ref_include_attr_shared_data_desc: Object containing shared data passed from parent. data attribute values take priority over shared_data
ref_include_attr_binding_id_desc: Unique identifier for this include instance. Required when including the same component multiple times
ref_include_data_sharing_desc: Use shared_data to pass data from the parent component to the included component. The included component can then access these values directly.
ref_include_nested_desc: Included components can themselves include other components, creating a hierarchy of reusable UI pieces. Data flows down through shared_data at each level.
ref_include_binding_id_desc: When including the same component multiple times, use binding_id to give each instance a unique identifier. This ensures proper state management for each instance.
ref_include_practice_1: Organize includes in a components/ directory structure
ref_include_practice_2: Keep components focused on a single responsibility
ref_include_practice_3: Pass only the data each component needs via shared_data
ref_include_practice_4: Use binding_id when including the same component multiple times
ref_include_practice_5: Limit nesting depth to 3 levels for maintainability
ref_styles_overview: Define reusable style templates to maintain consistent styling across your app.
ref_styles_file_structure: Each style is defined in a separate JSON file in the Styles/ directory. The filename (without .json) becomes the style name.
ref_styles_partial_attributes_desc: Apply different styles to specific portions of text within a Label or Button. Use partial_attributes to highlight keywords, create inline links, or apply varied formatting within a single text element.
ref_styles_partial_text_pattern_desc: Use range.text to match a specific substring in the text. The styling will be applied to the first occurrence of that text.
ref_styles_partial_numeric_range_desc: Use a numeric array [start, end] to specify exact character positions. Useful when you need precise control over which characters to style.
ref_styles_partial_onclick_desc: Add onclick to make a portion of text clickable. This creates an inline link that triggers a ViewModel method when tapped.
ref_styles_partial_prop_onclick: ViewModel method to call when tapped
ref_events_overview: Handle user interactions with event handlers bound to ViewModel methods.
ref_attributes_overview: Common attributes can be applied to most JsonUI components to control layout, styling, and behavior.
ref_attr_core_desc: Essential attributes for identifying and structuring components.
ref_attr_margins_desc: Margins and padding control the spacing around and within components.
ref_attr_alignment_desc: Alignment attributes control how components are positioned relative to their parent or sibling views.
ref_attr_interaction_desc: Interaction attributes control visibility, touch handling, and event responses.
ref_attr_zorder_desc: Z-order attributes control the stacking order of views.
attr_include_desc: Path to JSON file to include
attr_margins_desc: [top, right, bottom, left] or single value
attr_shadow_desc: Shadow config (color, offsetX, offsetY, opacity, radius)
attr_can_tap_desc: Enable tap capability for non-button views
ref_view_desc: The fundamental container component for building layouts. View acts as a flexible container that can hold other components and supports various layout configurations.
ref_view_attr_direction_desc: Child ordering direction: topToBottom, bottomToTop, leftToRight, rightToLeft
ref_view_attr_gravity_desc: Child alignment within the View: top, bottom, center, left, right
ref_view_attr_highlight_bg_desc: Background color when highlighted state is active
ref_view_attr_highlighted_desc: Whether the view is in highlighted state
ref_view_attr_cantap_desc: Enable tap capability for non-button views
ref_view_attr_tap_bg_desc: Background color when the view is tapped
ref_view_attr_onClick_desc: Closure-based click event handler using @{} syntax
ref_view_attr_shadow_desc: Shadow configuration object with color, offset, opacity, radius
ref_view_attr_cliptobounds_desc: Clip child content to view bounds
ref_view_attr_userinteraction_desc: Enable/disable user interaction on the view
ref_label_desc: A text display component for showing static or dynamic text content. Supports rich text formatting, links, and partial text styling.
ref_label_attr_text_desc: Text content to display (supports string keys for localization)
ref_label_attr_font_desc: Font name or family to use
ref_label_attr_fontweight_desc: Font weight: normal, bold, semibold, etc.
ref_label_attr_linebreak_desc: Line break mode: wordWrap, charWrap, clip, truncateHead, truncateTail, truncateMiddle
ref_label_partial_attributes_desc: Apply different styles to specific portions of text within a Label or Button. Use partial_attributes to highlight keywords, create inline links, or apply varied formatting within a single text element.
ref_label_partial_range_text_desc: Use range.text to match a specific substring in the text. The styling will be applied to the first occurrence of that text.
ref_label_partial_range_numeric_desc: Use a numeric array [start, end] to specify exact character positions. Useful when you need precise control over which characters to style.
ref_label_partial_onclick_desc: Add onclick to make a portion of text clickable. This creates an inline link that triggers a ViewModel method when tapped.
ref_label_partial_attr_range_desc: Range specification: { text: 'substring' } for pattern matching, or [start, end] for numeric positions
ref_label_partial_attr_fontcolor_desc: Text color for this range (hex or color name)
ref_label_partial_attr_fontweight_desc: Font weight: bold, semibold, normal, etc.
ref_label_partial_attr_underline_desc: Add underline decoration to this range
ref_label_partial_attr_strikethrough_des: Add strikethrough decoration to this range
ref_label_partial_attr_onclick_desc: ViewModel method name to call when this range is tapped
ref_button_desc: An interactive button component that responds to user taps. Supports various styles and click handlers.
ref_button_attr_enabled_desc: Whether the button is enabled (default: true)
ref_textfield_desc: A single-line text input component for user input. Supports placeholder text, keyboard types, and validation.
ref_textfield_attr_keyboardtype_desc: Keyboard type: default, email, number, phone, url
ref_textfield_attr_autocapitalize_desc: Capitalization mode: none, words, sentences, characters
ref_textview_desc: A multi-line text input component for longer user input. Supports scrolling and dynamic height.
ref_switch_desc: A toggle switch component for boolean on/off states. Supports custom colors and change handlers.
ref_switch_attr_label_desc: Text label displayed next to the switch
ref_switch_attr_enabled_desc: Whether the switch is interactive (supports data binding)
ref_slider_desc: A slider component for selecting values within a range. Supports min/max values and step increments.
ref_scrollview_desc: A scrollable container component for content that exceeds the viewport. Supports vertical and horizontal scrolling.
ref_collection_desc: A dynamic list component for rendering data arrays. Supports item templates, headers, and data binding.
comp_select_box_desc: A dropdown picker component for selecting from a list of options. Also supports date and time picker modes.
comp_select_box_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUISelectBox
comp_select_box_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Maps to Picker
comp_select_box_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to DropdownMenu
comp_select_box_react: • React/Next.js: Full support - Maps to select with Tailwind CSS
ref_select_box_desc: A dropdown picker component for selecting from a list of options. Supports static items, data binding, and date/time picker modes with various styles.
ref_select_box_attr_items_desc: Array of selectable items (can be strings or objects with value/text)
ref_select_box_attr_selectedindex_desc: Default selected item index. Can be integer or @{variableName}
ref_select_box_attr_prompt_desc: Placeholder text shown when no item is selected
ref_select_box_attr_datepickermode_desc: Date picker mode: date, time, datetime, countDown
ref_select_box_attr_datepickerstyle_desc: Date picker style: automatic, wheels, compact, inline (iOS 14.0+)
ref_select_box_attr_datestringformat_des: Date format string for display (e.g., yyyy/MM/dd)
ref_select_box_attr_enabled_desc: Whether the select box is enabled
comp_radio_desc: A radio button component for single selection from a group of options.
comp_radio_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUIRadioButton
comp_radio_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Custom RadioButton view
comp_radio_compose: • Jetpack Compose: Full support - Maps to RadioButton
ref_radio_desc: A radio button component for single selection from a group of options. Radio buttons with the same group name are mutually exclusive.
ref_radio_attr_text_desc: Label text displayed next to the radio button
ref_radio_attr_group_desc: Group name for mutual exclusivity. Radio buttons with the same group are linked
ref_radio_attr_checked_desc: Initial checked state. Can be boolean or @{variableName}
ref_radio_attr_value_desc: Associated value when this option is selected
ref_radio_attr_spacing_desc: Space between icon and text label
ref_radio_attr_onclick_desc: Handler called when radio button is tapped
ref_radio_attr_enabled_desc: Whether the radio button is enabled
ref_image_desc: A component for displaying local images from the app bundle. Supports various content modes and resizing options.
comp_image_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUIImageView
comp_image_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Maps to Image
ref_image_src_desc: Local image name from app bundle
ref_check_desc: A checkbox component for boolean selection. Supports custom icons and change handlers.
comp_check_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUICheckBox
comp_check_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Custom CheckBox view
ref_check_on_value_change_desc: Handler called when checked state changes
ref_table_desc: A table view component for displaying sectioned data lists. Supports headers, footers, and various cell styles.
comp_table_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUITableView
comp_table_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Maps to List
ref_progress_desc: A progress bar component for showing completion status. Supports custom colors and animation.
comp_progress_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to UIProgressView
comp_progress_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Maps to ProgressView
ref_progress_progress_tint_color_desc: Fill color for the progress portion
ref_indicator_desc: An activity indicator component for showing loading state. Supports different sizes and colors.
comp_indicator_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to UIActivityIndicatorView
comp_indicator_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Maps to ProgressView with spinning style
ref_segment_desc: A segmented control component for selecting from multiple options. Similar to UISegmentedControl.
comp_segment_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUISegmentedControl
comp_segment_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Maps to Picker with segmented style
ref_segment_items_desc: String array or comma-separated string for segment items
ref_segment_selected_index_desc: Selected segment index. Can be integer or @{variableName}
ref_segment_enabled_desc: Whether the segmented control is enabled
ref_segment_tint_color_desc: Tint color for the segmented control
ref_segment_normal_color_desc: Default color for text of items
ref_segment_selected_color_desc: Selected color for text of items
ref_segment_apportions_desc: Size segments based on content (UIKit only)
ref_network_image_desc: A component for loading and displaying remote images from URLs. Supports placeholder images and caching.
comp_network_image_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to NetworkImageView
comp_network_image_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Maps to AsyncImage
ref_network_image_default_image_desc: Default image to display while loading
ref_network_image_error_image_desc: Image to show when download fails
ref_network_image_onload_desc: Handler called when image loads successfully (React only)
ref_network_image_onerror_desc: Handler called when image fails to load (React only)
ref_network_image_cache_policy_desc: Cache policy for downloaded images (UIKit only)
ref_circle_image_desc: A circular image component for displaying avatars and profile pictures. Inherits from NetworkImage.
comp_circle_image_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to CircleImageView
comp_circle_image_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Maps to AsyncImage with circle clip shape
ref_circle_image_src_desc: URL string for remote image or local image name
ref_circle_image_default_image_desc: Default image name to display initially
ref_circle_image_error_image_desc: Image to show when download fails
ref_icon_label_desc: A component combining an icon with text label. Supports selection state and various icon positions.
comp_icon_label_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUILabelWithIcon
comp_icon_label_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Maps to Label or HStack/VStack with Image and Text
ref_icon_label_icon_position_desc: Icon position: Left, Right, Top, Bottom
ref_icon_label_text_shadow_desc: Text shadow with color, offset, blur
ref_icon_label_selected_desc: Selected state. Can be boolean or @{variableName}
ref_icon_label_enabled_desc: Whether the icon label is enabled
ref_gradient_view_desc: A view with gradient background. Supports linear gradients with customizable direction and colors.
comp_gradient_view_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to GradientView
comp_gradient_view_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Maps to LinearGradient
ref_gradient_view_gradient_desc: Array of color strings for the gradient
ref_blur_desc: A blur effect component for creating frosted glass effects. Based on UIVisualEffectView.
comp_blur_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUIVisualEffectView
comp_blur_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Maps to custom blur modifier
ref_blur_effect_style_desc: Blur style: Light, Dark, ExtraLight, Regular, Prominent, SystemMaterial, etc.
ref_circle_view_desc: A circular shape view component. Supports fill color, border, and stroke options.
comp_circle_view_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to SJUICircleView
comp_circle_view_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Maps to Circle or RoundedRectangle
ref_web_desc: A web view component for displaying web content. Based on WKWebView.
comp_web_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Maps to WKWebView
comp_web_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Maps to WKWebView wrapped in UIViewRepresentable
ref_web_url_desc: URL to load in web view
ref_web_allows_link_preview_desc: Enable link preview on long press
ref_safe_area_view_desc: A container that respects device safe area insets. Ensures content is not obscured by system UI elements.
comp_safe_area_view_uikit: • UIKit: Full support - Inherits from SJUIView with safe area handling
comp_safe_area_view_swiftui: • SwiftUI: Full support - Native safe area with customizable edges
ref_safe_area_view_inset_positions_desc: Controls which edges apply safe area insets: top, bottom, leading, trailing, all. Default: [all]
ref_safe_area_view_inherits_desc: Inherits all View attributes for layout and styling
ref_table_attr_columncount_desc: Number of columns for grid layout
ref_table_attr_items_desc: Data binding expression for collection items
ref_indicator_attr_size_desc: Indicator size: small, medium, large (React only)
cli_subtitle: Command-line tools for building JSON-based UIs across platforms
cli_swift_overview: SwiftJsonUI CLI (sjui) provides commands for generating, building, and managing iOS/macOS projects with JSON-based UI layouts. It supports both UIKit and SwiftUI targets.
cli_kotlin_overview: KotlinJsonUI CLI (kjui) provides commands for generating and building Android projects with JSON-based UI layouts. It supports both Jetpack Compose and XML layouts.
cli_react_overview: ReactJsonUI CLI (rjui) provides commands for generating and building React/Next.js projects with JSON-based UI layouts. It generates TypeScript components with Tailwind CSS styling.
cli_swift_init_desc: Initialize a new SwiftJsonUI project. Creates the required directory structure including Layouts, Styles, Strings, and Generated folders.
cli_swift_setup_desc: Setup project structure and install dependencies. Configures the project for SwiftJsonUI development.
cli_swift_generate_desc: Generate view files including JSON layout and Swift ViewModel. Supports view, partial, collection, and binding types.
cli_swift_build_desc: Build UIKit/SwiftUI Swift files from JSON layouts. Generates type-safe Swift code for all layouts.
cli_swift_watch_desc: Watch for file changes and automatically rebuild. Monitors Layouts, Styles, and Strings directories.
cli_swift_hotload_desc: Start HotLoader server for real-time UI updates. Connect iOS device or simulator for live preview without rebuilding.
cli_swift_destroy_desc: Remove a view and its related files. Deletes JSON layout, generated Swift files, and ViewModel.
cli_swift_validate_desc: Validate JSON layout files for syntax errors, unknown components, and invalid attributes.
cli_swift_convert_desc: Convert JSON layouts to native SwiftUI code. Useful for one-time migration from JSON-based UI to pure Swift code that doesn't depend on SwiftJsonUI.
cli_swift_global_options:
--log-level LEVEL  Set log level (error, warn, info, debug)
--quiet, -q        Show only errors
--verbose, -v      Show debug information
cli_kotlin_init_desc: Initialize a new KotlinJsonUI project. Use --mode compose for Jetpack Compose or --mode xml for XML layouts.
cli_kotlin_setup_desc: Setup project dependencies and configure Gradle for KotlinJsonUI.
cli_kotlin_generate_desc: Generate view files including JSON layout and Kotlin ViewModel. Supports view and component types.
cli_kotlin_build_desc: Build Kotlin files from JSON layouts. Generates Compose composables or XML layouts depending on mode.
cli_kotlin_hotload_desc: Start HotLoader for real-time UI updates on connected Android device without app rebuild.
cli_react_init_desc: Initialize ReactJsonUI in the current project. Creates Layouts, Styles, Strings directories and generates built-in components like NetworkImage.
cli_react_generate_desc: Generate view or component files with JSON layout and TypeScript ViewModel.
cli_react_build_desc: Build React TSX components from JSON layouts. Generates components in src/generated/ with Tailwind CSS styling.
cli_react_watch_desc: Watch for JSON file changes and auto-rebuild. Works seamlessly with Next.js hot reloading.
cli_react_hotload_desc: Control HotLoader for real-time updates. Use 'listen' to start, 'stop' to end, 'status' to check state.
cli_swift_gen_type_desc: Type to generate: view, partial, collection, binding, or converter (swiftui only)
cli_swift_convert_name_desc: Name of the view to convert to native SwiftUI
cli_swift_convert_togroup_desc: Convert from VStack/HStack to Group for flexible layouts
cli_swift_destroy_type_desc: Type to destroy: view, partial, or collection
cli_swift_destroy_name_desc: Name of the view/component to delete
cli_swift_validate_files_desc: JSON files to validate (optional, defaults to all files in Layouts directory)
cli_swift_gen_root_desc: Generate as root view controller (creates navigation setup)
cli_swift_gen_attributes_desc: Custom attributes for converter (e.g., text:String color:Color)
cli_swift_convert_input_desc: Input JSON file path to convert
cli_swift_convert_output_desc: Output Swift file path (optional, defaults to same name with .swift extension)
cli_kotlin_gen_type_desc: Type to generate: view or component
cli_react_gen_type_desc: Type to generate: view or component
cli_react_gen_attributes_desc: Add custom attributes to the component
